Merge pull request #33 from orien/project-metadata

Add project metadata to the gemspec
Add project metadata to the gemspec

Merge pull request #24 from LewisVo/patch-1

Fix a weird problem with readme
Fix a weird problem with readme

Merge pull request #23 from Davidslv/patch-1

Update README.md

Update README.md

Most of us have been using RSpec long enough to have this step memorised, although it's not clear for newcomers how to setup RSpec after installing it. I would like to add this small change so it makes it easier for newcomers to get started.

Thank you.
David

Merge pull request #7 from rspec/new-cert

Add the new certificate
Add my signature for the new certificate
Bump version to 3.1.0.pre to prevent confusion with master being 3.0.0 but 3.0.x releases are out.

Ruby 2.1 has deprecated File.exists

Merge pull request #4 from simi/patch-1

Update rspec version in README.md.

Don't specify version in README.md.

[ci skip]

Merge pull request #3 from rspec/rspec_support

Uses rspec-support from the local dev directory
Uses rspec-support from the local dev directory

Don't explicitly require mocks and expectations upfront.

rspec-core will require them at the appropriate time as
long as the user hasn't configured a different mocking
or expectation library. We don't want to load them
unnecessarily.

Merge pull request #2 from vfrride/patch-1

Uses secure RubyGems URL
remove obsolete guard against building gems in ruby 1.9.3
generalize version-specific URLs in the README
add license to gemspec (and consequently the gem)
update email addy and homepage in gemspec
update License and/or authors in gemspec
raise when trying to build gem if Psych is defined

depend on any 2.0.x version of rspec-[core|expectations|mocks]

- allows us to release upgrades of those dependencies without having to
  release all of them together
Removed default executable--this gem doesn't have any executables, actually.

Remove dependency on jeweler.

- Allows us to have an always-up-to-date gemspec.
- Use bundler's build/install/release rake tasks rather than jeweler's.
- One less development dependency.
- No need for a separate VERSION file.
change top-level module from Rspec to RSpec
add gem:push task (was removed from jeweler)
depend expliticitly on same rspec version
Testing out new version write functionality
Added tasks for cloning the other rspec repos initially.

The default rake task now runs the default rake task for each project

This enables rcov, and cucumber features to run in projects that have
them.
Updating the rakefile alias status as st, and add diff
add lib (so you can just require 'rpsec')
add rake tasks for git push and pull
add git status task for all repos
Adding a chrome to the spec task
add deps on other rspec packages
